creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
When a page is deactivated, it's entry in content/live/sitetree.xml is not
removed. The content from content/live is removed.
The label is removed, but empty nodes are not purged.
creator: andreas@apache.org

text:
might not be related, but i've seen empty uuid node directories frequently. no
more content, no refs in sitetree.xml, but the empty dir stays.
but that might be caused by my custom pub being out of sync with the latest
changes to the default pub...
creator: nettings@apache.org

text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> might not be related, but i've seen empty uuid node directories frequently. no
> more content, no refs in sitetree.xml, but the empty dir stays.

Strange, this should be handled by the content janitor. Maybe you could try to
debug it?
creator: andreas@apache.org

text:
(In reply to comment #0)
> When a page is deactivated, it's entry in content/live/sitetree.xml is not
> removed. The content from content/live is removed.

Confirmed. I added a failing test case.
creator: andreas@apache.org
andreas@apache.org
text:
The empty node is now removed.

Jörn, would you mind filing another bug for the issue you mentioned? Thanks!
